name: Occupation of the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge
note: The 3 Percenters and several other armed militia organizations take over the headquarters of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service's Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in Harney County, Oregon, in a series of incidents stemming from the 2014 Bundy standoff. FBI ends the occupation with a shootout, killing one militiaman and arresting five others, including leader Ammon Bundy.
credit: By USFWS - Pacific Region - Damage at Malheur NWR, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=48585904
caption: Damage at Malheur NWR

name: Hesston shooting
note: A disgruntled former employee opens fire in an office building in Hesston, Kansas, killing three people and injuring fourteen others.

name: 2016 Donald Trump Chicago rally protest
note: At least four people are injured and five are arrested in Chicago when protesters demonstrating against Donald Trump scuffle with Trump supporters at a canceled Trump rally.
credit: By nathanmac87 - https://www.flickr.com/photos/nathanmac87/25619534911/in/dateposted/, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=47475490
caption: Protest at Donald Trump Rally in Chicago on March 11, 2016

name: Pike County shootings
note: Eight family members are shot to death at four locations in Pike County, Ohio. Three children survive the attacks.

name: Orlando nightclub shooting
note: 29-year-old Omar Mateen opens fire at Pulse, a gay dance club in Orlando, killing 49 people and leaving another 53 wounded. The attack surpassed the 2007 Virginia Tech shootings as the deadliest mass shooting in U.S. history until the 2017 Las Vegas shooting. The shooting is investigated as a domestic terrorist attack.
credit: By Michael Rivera - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=58868613
caption: The Pulse building with the memorial fence in March 2017

name: 2016 Sacramento riot
note: Ten people are hospitalized, five with stab wounds, after a group of counter-protesters attack a white supremacist gathering in Sacramento, California.
credit: By Robert Couse-Baker - https://www.flickr.com/photos/29233640@N07/27835374742/in/photolist-JpHz9b-JrSNYK-HBpeZy-HBpcTu-HBpbcd-HBpa2s-HzZhPL-J4CqLN-JkeTSo-JpBRr7-JsCpHc-HwAB1u-HwAAnW-JkfNC2-HZ3L8q-JfE5aj-JqPfUN-JsCpH2-HvhcJk-JmzXEb-HZ3L4Y-HZ3KWJ-JfE4Ys-HZ3KT7-JfE4UE-HZ3KLy-JfE4J9-HZ3KA3-JfE4B5-JpBzuM-JpBzgF-Htxsa6-JhUGgr-HtxrPr-HtxrAR-JhUG7i-JhUFUV-JmzWu5-JfE3PJ-HZ3Jpq-JhUFye-HZ3JjW-HZ3JcG-JodG6p-JdaQfy-HpuDiQ-JhxjtW-Jhxj4Y-HpzXrT-HpzX2e, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=49785149
caption: A crowd outside the California State Capitol after the riot. An anarchist flag is carried in the foreground. Debris lies on the plaza.

name: 2016 shooting of Dallas police officers
note: During a peaceful Black Lives Matter protest in Dallas, Texas, a sniper later identified as Micah Xavier Johnson opens fire, killing five Dallas police officers and injuring another eleven people in the deadliest incident for U.S. law enforcement since September 11, 2001. Johnson is later found to have targeted white people (specifically white police officers) and to have been interested in several black nationalist groups. He is killed by a C-4 bomb delivered by a robot, the first use of lethal force by a robot by an American police department.
credit: By The White House - facebook (s), Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=50114235
caption: "That’s what I take away from the lives of these outstanding men. The pain we feel may not soon pass, but my faith tells me that they did not die in vain. I believe our sorrow can make us a better country. I believe our righteous anger can be transformed into more justice and more peace. Weeping may endure for a night, but I’m convinced joy comes in the morning.” —President Obama at the memorial service for the fallen officers of the Dallas Police Department:

name: Killing of Tony Timpa
note: Police in Dallas, Texas kill Tony Timpa, who suffered from schizophrenia and depression, after he asked for help. The police laughed as he asked for help 30 times while they pinned his shoulders, knees, and neck to the ground.

name: 2016 New York and New Jersey bombings
note: On September 17–19, 2016, three bombs exploded and several unexploded ones were found in the New York metropolitan area. The bombings left 31 people wounded, but no fatalities or life-threatening injuries were reported.
credit: By C. Mendoza/VOA - VOA http://www.voanews.com/a/loud-explosion-reported-manhattan-chelsea-neighborhood/3513981.html, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=51518047
caption: A police officer instructs a civilian, as other police, fire and EMS crews work near the scene of the bomb explosion.

name: 2016 United States presidential election
note: Donald Trump is elected as the 45th President of the United States and Mike Pence is elected the 48th Vice President, with Trump becoming the oldest man elected president at the age of 70 as well as the first president in history to take the office without any prior political or military experience. The win is considered one of the most shocking upsets in U.S. history, with most news outlets and experts considering a Trump victory unlikely. The result is also highly controversial due to Hillary Clinton's popular vote lead of nearly 3 million votes over Trump, who won via the Electoral College.
credit: Mr.Election & Ali Zifan, CC BY-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons
caption: Results of 2016 U.S. presidential election by congressional district, shaded by vote margin.

name: Dakota Access Pipeline protests
note: On Novermber 20th, More than 300 people are injured, 26 seriously, after police use water cannons, tear gas, rubber bullets, and concussion grenades on a peaceful protest against the proposed construction of the Dakota Access Pipeline on the Standing Rock Indian Reservation.
credit: By Tony Webster from Minneapolis, Minnesota - Sacred Stone Camp, CC BY-SA 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=54799791
caption: Sacred Stone Camp

name: Pizzagate shooting
note: A man from Salisbury, North Carolina briefly opens fire with an AR-15 style rifle inside Comet Ping Pong, a pizzeria in Washington, D.C., wishing to "self-investigate" the establishment implicated in a false conspiracy theory that claims the restaurant is used by members of the Democratic Party for a child-sex ring. No injuries are reported, and the man is arrested without incident and immediately charged with assault with a dangerous weapon.
credit: By Farragutful - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=54137782
caption: Proponents of Pizzagate connected Comet Ping Pong (pictured) to a fictitious child sex ring[1]

name: Chicago torture incident
note: Four African-American individuals kidnap a mentally disabled white man in Chicago, Illinois and livestream their torture of him on Facebook, shouting "F*** Trump" and "F*** white people" while doing so, prompting widespread reactions on social media. The four suspects are later arrested and charged with a hate crime.

name: Trump travel ban
note: President Trump signs an executive order banning the entry of refugees of the Syrian Civil War into the United States indefinitely, and banning the entry of all nationals, regardless of visa status, of Iran, Iraq, Syria, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, and Yemen to the US for 90 days. The order prompts international criticism, a lawsuit from the American Civil Liberties Union, the detainment of legal Muslim travelers at several international airports, and Iran announcing a ban on entry of US citizens into the country until the ban is lifted.
credit: By Sean Spicer, White House Press Secretary @ twitter - Caption; Picture URL, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=57149033
caption: Trump at the signing of Executive Order 13780.

name: 2017 Olathe, Kansas shooting
note: An Indian engineer is shot dead and another injured in Olathe, Kansas, in an apparent hate crime

name: Protests erupt in cities across the country
note: Hundreds of President Trump's supporters clash with anti-Trump protesters in Berkeley, California. 21 people are arrested. Protests erupt in cities across the country, most notably at Mar-a-Lago with hundreds of thousands of demonstrators demanding President Trump release his tax returns.
credit: By Pax Ahimsa Gethen - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=62755236
caption: Protesters and police officers fill Sproul Plaza on September 24, 2017

name: 2017 Portland train attack
note: An anti-Muslim stabbing attack aboard a Portland, Oregon commuter train kills two people and injures a third.
credit: By Ninjanabe - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=59426975
caption: Memorial for victims at the Hollywood Transit Center

name: Congressional baseball shooting
note: House of Representatives Majority Whip Steve Scalise and his aides are hit by gunfire during a baseball practice in Virginia. The shooter is killed by a security detail.

name: Jeff Bezos becomes the world's richest person
note: Jeff Bezos briefly becomes the world's richest person, surpassing Bill Gates with a net worth of just over $90 billion. He loses the title later in the day when Amazon's stock drops, returning him to second place with a net worth just below $90 billion.
credit: By Steve Jurvetson - Flickr: Bezos’ Iconic Laugh, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=21166413
caption: Bezos in 2010

name: Unite the Right rally
note: The Unite the Right rally, a gathering of alt-right, white nationalist, neo-Nazi, and neo-Confederate groups protesting the removal of the Robert Edward Lee Sculpture and other Confederate monuments and memorials from public spaces, is held in Charlottesville, Virginia. Violent clashes break out between attendees and counter-protesters; 32-year-old Heather Heyer is killed and many others are injured when a car ploughs into a group of people; and two Virginia State Police troopers are killed when their surveillance helicopter crashes, prompting Governor Terry McAuliffe to declare a state of emergency.
credit: By Anthony Crider; cropped by Beyond My Ken (talk) 20:37, 9 April 2018 (UTC) - Charlottesville "Unite the Right" Rally, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=68193094
caption: Alt-right members preparing to enter Emancipation Park holding Nazi, Confederate, and Gadsden "Don't Tread on Me" flags.

name: Hurricane Irma
note: Millions of homes are left without power as the center of Hurricane Irma hits mainland Florida, just south of Naples.
credit: By NOAA National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service (NESDIS) - https://www.nesdis.noaa.gov/content/goes-16-sees-three-hurricanes-atlantic, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=67039446
caption: Three simultaneously active hurricanes on September 7. From left to right: Katia, Irma, and Jose, the first occurrence since 2010.

name: Trump's 2017 U.N. speech
note: President Trump makes his first appearance at the United Nations, during which he claims the US may 'have no choice but to totally destroy North Korea'.
caption: Full video: Trump UN Speech 2017

name: Las Vegas shooting
note: Las Vegas is the site of the first professional sports event in the city's history when the Vegas Golden Knights host the Arizona Coyotes at T-Mobile Arena there is a pre-game ceremony before puck drop to honor the victims of the mass shooting that had occurred nine days earlier.
credit: By Jennifer Morrow from San Francisco - View from the Foundation Room, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=63068688
caption: At Mandalay Bay

name: Me Too movement
note: The Me Too (or #MeToo) movement, with variations of related local or international names, is a social movement against sexual abuse and sexual harassment towards women, where people publicize allegations of sex crimes. The phrase "Me Too" was initially used in this context on social media in 2006, on Myspace, by sexual harassment survivor and activist Tarana Burke.
credit: By Donna Rotunno, Attribution, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=95202136
caption: Me Too movement sign at a march.

name: 2017 New York City truck attack
note: A flatbed pickup truck is driven into pedestrians along West Street in Lower Manhattan, New York City, causing at least eight deaths and multiple injuries.
credit: By Gh9449 - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=63791131
caption: The Home Depot rental truck used by perpetrator Sayfullo Habibullaevich Saipov during the 2017 Lower Manhattan attack, the morning after the incident.

name: Sutherland Springs church shooting
note: 26-year-old Devin Kelley kills 26 people and injures 20 in a Baptist church in Sutherland Springs, Texas. It is the 5th deadliest shooting in United States history, and the deadliest in a place of worship.

name: Rancho Tehama Reserve shootings
note: A gunman embarks on a shooting spree across Rancho Tehama Reserve, California, killing a total of four people and wounding twelve others before being shot and killed by police. He had earlier murdered his wife in their home.

name: 2017 California wildfires
note: A state of emergency is declared in California as the worst wildfires on record devastate homes and businesses in the region, forcing the evacuation of 200,000 people.
credit: By NASA - https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/NaturalHazards/view.php?id=90547&src=twitter-nh, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=60824644
caption: On July 8, 2017, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this image of smoke streaming from the Alamo fire. Actively burning areas, detected by MODIS’s thermal bands, are outlined in red. Through July 10, 2017, the fire had charred roughly 30,000 acres (100 square kilometers) in San Luis Obispo County, California. Meanwhile, the Whittier fire, near Cachuma Lake (Santa Barbara County) had scorched 10,000 acres.

name: 2017 New York City attempted bombing
note: A man is arrested after an explosion at New York's Port Authority Bus Terminal, described by Mayor Bill de Blasio as an "attempted terrorist attack".
credit: By The All-Nite Images from NY, NY, USA - Manhattan, CC BY-SA 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=39485952
caption: Passage between the 7 and 8 Ave Subway lines at Times Square.

name: California Man Planned Christmas Attack On San Francisco's Pier 39
note: Everitt Aaron Jameson, a 25-year-old former marine, is arrested by the FBI on suspicion of planning a terror attack in the Pier 39 area of San Francisco over Christmas.

name: Hawaii Emergency Management Agency
note: The Hawaii Emergency Management Agency sends a false alarm warning of an incoming ballistic missile attack, causing widespread panic across the state.

name: 2018 NRA boycott
note: In the wake of concerns about gun control, a number of major companies announce they are severing ties with the National Rifle Association (NRA) – including Alamo, Allied Van Lines, Avis Rent a Car, Budget Rent a Car, Delta, Enterprise, First National Bank of Omaha, Hertz, Met Life, National, SimpliSafe, Symantec, Teladoc, and United.

name: Stoneman Douglas High School shooting
note: A mass shooting occurs at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, resulting in 17 passings. It is the deadliest high school shooting in the United States, surpassing the 1999 Columbine High School massacre.
credit: By Source, Fair use, https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?curid=64999869
caption: CCTV still showing the shooter on the second floor of the building.

name: Florida Governor Signs Package Of New Gun Restrictions
note: Florida passes a law by 67–50 votes to raise the age to buy a gun from 18 to 21 after the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting.

name: Hart family crash
note: Six children are killed by their adoptive mothers, Jennifer and Sarah Hart, when their SUV intentionally drives over a California cliff in a mass murder-suicide. Both perpetrators were known to have abused their six children before the crash.

name: YouTube headquarters shooting
note: Three people suffer gunshot wounds when a female shooter, Nasim Najafi Aghdam, attacks the YouTube headquarters in California, before killing herself.
credit: By Coolcaesar - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=57865545
caption: This office building at 901 Cherry Avenue in San Bruno, California was home to the headquarters of YouTube at the time this photograph was taken. Photographed by user Coolcaesar on April 2, 2017 in San Bruno, California.

name: Mark Zuckerberg’s Senate hearing
note: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg is questioned in a joint session of several US senate committees, after the revelation that 87 million people had their private information accessed by Cambridge Analytica.
caption: Zuckerberg's Senate hearing highlights in 10 minutes

name: Nashville Waffle House shooting
note: Four people are killed at a Waffle House restaurant in Nashville, Tennessee, when a naked gunman shoots them with a semi-automatic rifle before fleeing on foot. The gunman is captured the next day after a manhunt.

name: U.S. Unemployment Lowest Since 2000
note: The national unemployment rate hits 3.9 percent, the lowest rate since 2000.

name: Santa Fe High School shooting
note: A school shooting takes place at Santa Fe High School in Texas. Eight students and two teachers are killed and ten other people are injured.

name: Protests against the Trump administration family separation policy
note: Hundreds of thousands of people demonstrate across all 50 U.S. states against family separations carried out by the United States.
credit: By Charles Edward Miller - https://www.flickr.com/photos/74207111@N00/28758035048/, CC BY-SA 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=70009139
caption: Stop Separating Immigrant Families Press Conference and Rally, Chicago. (June 5, 2018)

name: Shooting of Antwon Rose Jr.
note: On the same day that the United States announces that it will withdraw from the United Nations Human Rights Council, Antwon Rose Jr. a 17-year-old African-American man is shot and killed by white Pittsburgh police officer Michael Rosfeld.
credit: By Source (WP:NFCC#4), Fair use, https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?curid=57741071
caption: Antwon Rose II in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

name: Capital Gazette shooting
note: Five people are killed in a mass shooting in the newsroom of The Capital newspaper in Annapolis, Maryland.

name: Trump Putin private meeting
note: President Trump meets with Russian President Vladimir Putin for private talks in the Finnish capital Helsinki. In a press conference afterwards, Trump praises Russia and Putin, drawing sharp criticism from both Republicans and Democrats alike. Senator John McCain describes it as "one of the most disgraceful performances by an American president in memory."
credit: By Kremlin.ru, CC BY 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=70907150
caption: С Президентом Соединённых Штатов Америки Дональдом Трампом. / With President of the United States of America Donald Trump.

name: 2018 California wildfires
note: Wildfires in northern California continue to rage across vast swathes of land, destroying hundreds of structures and causing several deaths.
credit: By Cyclonebiskit - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=74297315
caption: The Woolsey Fire encroaching on Malibu on November 9

name: Jacksonville Landing shooting
note: A mass shooting occurs during a Madden NFL 19 tournament at the Jacksonville Landing in Jacksonville, Florida, resulting in three fatalities including the perpetrator.
credit: By DXR - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=50281867
caption: A southeast view of the Jacksonville Landing, Jacksonville, Florida

name: Brett Kavanaugh Supreme Court nomination
note: The Senate confirms Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination by a vote of 50–48, amid controversy over sexual assault claims against him.
credit: By Ryan1783 - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=73437999
caption: A protest against the confirmation of Brett Kavanaugh as Associate Justice of the United States was held in Seattle, Washington on 6 October 2018.

name: United States mail bombing attempts
note: After a bomb was found at the home of George Soros in the suburbs of New York, suspected explosive devices are also sent to former US President Barack Obama and ex-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. The latter devices are intercepted by technicians who screen mail sent to former US officials. The Time Warner building in New York (home to news broadcaster CNN) is also evacuated, after a package containing an explosive and suspicious powder is found addressed to former CIA Director John Brennan. Additional suspicious packages, addressed to Democratic Representative Maxine Waters and former Attorney General Eric Holder, are investigated by law enforcement.
credit: By FBI - https://www.fbi.gov/news/pressrel/press-releases/statement-on-the-fbis-investigation-of-suspicious-packages[1], Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=73853521
caption: FBI’s Investigation of Suspicious Packages: https://www.fbi.gov/news/pressrel/press-releases/statement-on-the-fbis-investigation-of-suspicious-packages

name: Pittsburgh synagogue shooting
note: A mass shooting occurs at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, leaving 11 congregants dead. A 46-year-old male suspect is arrested and charged on making anti-semitic chants.
credit: By daveynin from United States - People paid for the respect, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=74877748
caption: People pay their respects at a memorial to the victims of a mass shooting in front of the Tree of Life - Or L'Simcha Congregation in Squirrel Hill, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, on November 4, 2018.

name: 800 U.S. soldiers deployed to the Mexico border
note: 800 U.S. soldiers are deployed to the Mexico–United States border as a part of Operation Faithful Patriot, reinforcing the border against incoming Central American migrant caravans.
credit: By U.S. Government - https://www.dvidshub.net/image/4853209/northcom-supports-southwest-border-security, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=74861035
caption: U.S. Air Force General Terrance J. O'Shaughnessy, Commander of the North American Aerospace Defense Command and U.S. Northern Command provides guidance to Department of Defense personnel, in coordination with Customs and Border Protection liaison officers and other supporting interagency partners, during a planning and operational update briefing about mission-enhancing DoD capabilities that will be provided in support of the Department of Homeland Security, Oct. 28, 2018. USNORTHCOM serves as the synchronizer of DoD forces providing mission-enhancing capabilities in support of DHS and CBP along the Southwest Border.

name: 2018 United States mid-term elections
note: The Democrats gain 40 seats to take control of the House of Representatives, but lose two seats in the Senate.

name: Thousand Oaks shooting
note: 12 people and the perpetrator are killed in a shooting at the Borderline Bar and Grill, in Thousand Oaks, California, about 40 miles (65 km) north-west of Los Angeles.
credit: By TOLocal - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=76432889
caption: Flowers outside Borderline Bar & Grill following the 2018 mass shooting.

name: 2018–2019 United States federal government shutdown
note: A partial shutdown of the government begins after Congress fails to agree a budget.
caption: Donald Trump meets with Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer on December 11, 2018, stating "I will be the one to shut it down."

name: Washington state gun law
note: Washington state bans all persons under 21 years of age from purchasing a semi-automatic assault rifle.

name: The Democrats take control of the House of Representatives
note: The Democrats take control of the House of Representatives, with a promise to end the government shutdown, but without funding for President Donald Trump's proposed border wall. The Republicans increase their control of the United States Senate.
credit: By The White House from Washington, DC - 2019 State of the Union, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=76391688
caption: 2019 State of the Union Address

name: Aurora, Illinois shooting
note: Gary Montez Martin murders five people and injures six others in a mass shooting at Henry Pratt Company in Aurora, Illinois.

name: Global School strike
note: Hundreds of students stage a walkout and rally at the Capitol building, demanding legal action on climate change. They are joined by students in over 1,600 simultaneous protests in 100 countries around the world.
credit: By Intothewoods7 - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=77367186
caption: School strike in San Francisco on 15 March 2019

name: Bump stock
note: "Bump stocks" are made illegal in the United States.
credit: By WASR - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=63131657
caption: A Slide Fire Solutions bump fire stock on a WASR-10 semiautomatic rifle

name: Louisiana black church fires
note: Arson is suspected as the cause of three fires in historically black churches since March 26 in St. Landry Parish, Louisiana. A fourth, smaller fire was set at a majority-white church in Caddo Parish on March 31. The culprit in the case of the three black churches is arrested and charged on April 11.

name: Poway synagogue shooting
note: A mass shooting occurs at the Chabad of Poway synagogue in Poway, California on the last day of Passover, resulting in one death and three injuries.

name: University of North Carolina at Charlotte shooting
note: A school shooting takes place at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte, leaving two people dead and four injured.
credit: By Bz3rk - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=7105153
caption: Ucity

name: STEM School Highlands Ranch shooting
note: A school shooting occurs at the STEM School Highlands Ranch in Douglas County, Colorado, leaving one dead and seven injured.
credit: By Daniel Hager - Own work, CC0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=78785313
caption: STEM School Highlands Ranch

name: 2019 Virginia Beach shooting
note: 12 people are killed, including the perpetrator, and four are injured in a mass shooting at a municipal center in Virginia Beach, Virginia.

name: Brandon Webber killing
note: At least two dozen police officers and two journalists are injured in overnight riots in Memphis, Tennessee after U.S. Marshals kill a 20-year-old black man, Brandon Webber, during an attempted arrest.

name: Jeffrey Epstein arrested
note: Billionaire financier and registered sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is arrested on federal charges of sex trafficking and additionally charged by the Southern District of New York with sex trafficking and with conspiracy to traffic minors in Florida and New York. He was found unresponsive in his jail cell on August 10.
credit: By Department of Justice - Released federal files https://www.motherjones.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Epstein.Docs_.redacted.pdf, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=84893344
caption: Jeffrey Epstein's final mugshot before his death

name: Gilroy Garlic Festival shooting
note: Four people, including the shooter, are killed and twelve others injured in a mass shooting in Gilroy, California.
credit: By FASTILY - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=71404583
caption: The Garlic Festival, 2018

name: El Paso Walmart shooting
note: A mass shooting occurs at a Walmart near the Cielo Vista Mall in El Paso, Texas, resulting in 23 fatalities and 23 injured.

name: 2019 Dayton shooting
note: A mass shooting occurs in the Oregon Historic District in downtown Dayton, Ohio, resulting in 10 fatalities (including the perpetrator) and 27 injuries.
credit: By Becker1999 - https://www.flickr.com/photos/becker271/48464964837/in/photostream/, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=81077940
caption: Ned Peppers Bar after 2019 Dayton shooting

name: End Domestic Terrorism rally
note: Protests are held in Portland that rally: Proud Boys Three Percenters, a “patriot movement” militia group, and American Guard. They are met with three times as many counter protesters. Anti-gun rallies are held in over 100 cities in all 50 states.
credit: By Source (WP:NFCC#4), Fair use, https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?curid=61505581
caption: Promotional artwork for the End Domestic Terrorism event in Portland, Oregon

name: Midland–Odessa shooting
note: Seven people are killed and 21 others wounded in a shooting in West Texas, between the cities of Midland and Odessa. The suspect is shot and killed by police outside a movie theater in Odessa.

name: Gun control
note: The San Francisco Board of Supervisors passes a resolution calling the NRA a "domestic terrorist organization". Walmart announces they will stop selling handgun ammunition and certain types of ammo for short-barrelled rifles. Kroger asks shoppers to refrain from openly carrying guns even if it is legal. Other major retailers follow suit. President and CEO Dennis Veilleux of gun manufacturer Colt announces the company will stop producing rifles such as the AR-15 for personal use.

name: School strike for climate
note: Thousands of students across the United States join their counterparts world-wide in demonstrations against climate change. The demonstrations are led by 16-year-old Swedish activist Greta Thunberg and 12-year-old Colorado activist Haven Coleman.
credit: By Intothewoods7 - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=77367186
caption: School strike in San Francisco on 15 March 2019

name: Greenville shooting
note: Two are killed and at least twelve injured at a shooting during a party in Greenville, Texas, celebrating the homecoming of Texas A&M University–Commerce.

name: Orinda shooting
note: Five are killed and four wounded in a shooting at a house party in Orinda, California.

name: Gun laws in Oklahoma
note: A law that allows almost all citizens to open carry guns goes into effect in Oklahoma.

name: 2019 Fresno shooting
note: Four people are killed and six are wounded in a shooting at a football-watch party in Fresno, California.

name: Naval Air Station Pensacola shooting
note: Four people die in a mass shooting by a Saudi aviation student that was being trained by the U.S. military.
credit: By Kevin King from Pensacola, FL, US of A - Skydive Airshow, NAS Pensacola, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=6079642
caption: Pensacola from the air

name: 2019 Jersey City shooting
note: A mass shooting occurs at a kosher grocery store in Jersey City, New Jersey. The attack is officially designated domestic terrorism two days later.
credit: By Djflem - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=84847149
caption: JC Kosher Supermarket & entrance to Khal Adas Greenville (left), Martin Luther King Drive in Greenville (on Jackson Hill), Jersey City, New Jersey 07305

name: First impeachment of Donald Trump
note: The U.S. House of Representatives votes largely along party lines to forward two articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump to the Senate, accusing him of abuse of power and obstructing Congress. Donald Trump becomes the third U.S. president to be impeached by the House.
credit: By United States House of Representatives - House Floorcast – Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=85037886
caption: On December 18, 2019, United States House of Representatives votes to adopt the articles of impeachment, accusing Donald Trump of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

name: Englewood Chicago shooting
note: At least 13 people are injured during a shooting at a memorial for an earlier shooting victim in Englewood, Chicago, IL.

name: 2020 VCDL Lobby Day
note: 22,000 people attend a gun rights rally at the Virginia State Capitol in Richmond to protest proposed gun laws.
credit: By Anthony Crider - https://www.flickr.com/photos/16086041@N00/49416381422/, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=86145663
caption: Armed demonstrators at the Lobby Day rally, January 20, 2020

name: Human-to-human transmission of the COVID-19
note: COVID-19 pandemic: The CDC confirms the first case of human-to-human transmission of the COVID-19 coronavirus in the U.S.

name: First death from COVID-19
note: COVID-19 pandemic: The first death from COVID-19 in the U.S. is reported by officials in Washington state, as the total number of cases nationwide reaches 66.

name: COVID-19 Pandemic
note: President Trump declares a national emergency in response to the COVID-19 pandemic on Mar 13. More than 27,400,000 confirmed cases have been reported since January 2020, resulting in more than 480,000 deaths in 2020.

name: Shooting of Breonna Taylor
note: Breonna Taylor, a 26-year-old emergency medical technician, is shot eight times by Louisville police during a no-knock warrant as part of a narcotics investigation.
credit: By Source (WP:NFCC#4), Fair use, https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?curid=65235229
caption: Breonna Taylor at a graduation ceremony in Louisville, Kentucky

name: School closed nationwide
note: COVID-19 pandemic: Most schools nationwide are closed by this date.

name: The U.S. becomes the worst country for COVID-19
note: The U.S. becomes the country with the highest number of reported COVID-19 deaths: over 20,000, overtaking Italy.

name: George Floyd killing
note: Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin is videotaped kneeling on the neck of George Floyd, 46, until he dies, as three other officers watch. Video of the incident goes viral and the four officers are subsequently fired. Major protests begin in the Minneapolis–Saint Paul (Twin Cities) area following the killing of George Floyd.
credit: By Source (WP:NFCC#4), Fair use, https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?curid=64103075
caption: This is a picture of George Floyd in 2016. He later died May 25th, 2020, after a white police officer knelt on his neck for at least seven minutes.

name: George Floyd protests
note: Curfews are declared in Los Angeles, Philadelphia and Atlanta as riots and protests continue nationwide. The weeks' rioting is termed the worst instance of civil unrest in the United States since the 1968 King assassination riots.
credit: By Leonhard Lenz - Own work, CC0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=91000999
caption: Protest at Alexanderplatz in Berlin on June 6

name: Killing of Rayshard Brooks
note: Protests breakout in Atlanta following the killing of Rayshard Brooks, 27, by a police officer in the parking lot of a fast food restaurant. The next day, June 13, Atlanta Chief of Police Erika Shields resigns and protesters burn down the fast food restaurant where the incident took place.
credit: By Prepositioned recording device - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wLdpbq7iyRE&t=2056, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=91505853
caption: Devin Brosnan's body camera recorded police officer Garrett Rolfe questioning Rayshard Brooks in a restaurant parking lot shortly before Rolfe shot Brooks.

name: Trump deploys feds on George Floyd protests
note: George Floyd protests: President Trump announces a "surge" in deployments of federal officers to Democratic-run cities, following an earlier crackdown on protests in Oregon.
credit: By Tedder - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=92544502
caption: Tear gas from w:BORTAC and fires at w:Mark O. Hatfield United States Courthouse during the 2020 w:George Floyd protests in Portland, Oregon.

name: U.S. Economy Drops 32.9% In Worst GDP Report Ever
note: Federal economic figures show a 32.9% annualized rate of GDP contraction between April and June, the sharpest decline since records began in 1945.

name: Mark Zuckerberg became the third centibillionaire
note: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg reaches a net worth exceeding $100 billion, becoming the third centibillionaire, alongside Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates.
credit: By Anthony Quintano from Honolulu, HI, United States https://www.flickr.com/people/22882274@N04
caption: Mark Zuckerberg F8 2018 Keynote

name: 2020 California wildfires
note: During a record-breaking heat wave, a remnant thunderstorm from Tropical Storm Fausto spawns hundreds of wildfires in California. California sets a new record for land area destroyed by wildfires, with 2.1 million acres burned in the year thus far.
credit: By National Weather Service - https://madriverunion.com/the-psps-is-winding-down-but-now-everything-is-orange/ https://madriverunion.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Orangeland.jpg, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=93980304
caption: September 10 satellite image of the wildfires burning in California and Oregon; The Aurora Fire on June 26, 2020; The Bobcat Fire burning in the San Gabriel mountains near Monrovia; Smoke from the North Complex over the Bay Bridge on September 9; An orange sky over Eureka on Sept 9; The CZU Lightning Complex fires along Butano Ridge on August 18; The Loyalton Fire near Calpine; The Hennessey and Spanish Fires burn towards Lake Berryessa on Aug. 18, 2020

name: Shooting of Jacob Blake
note: Violent protests break out in Kenosha, Wisconsin following the shooting of Jacob Blake, 29, by a police officer.
credit: By Lightburst - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=93752071
caption: 1,000 National Guard troops were sent to Kenosha to restore order during protests.[50]

name: Kenosha unrest
note: Two people are fatally shot overnight during unrest in Kenosha, Wisconsin; a suspect is arrested. Professional athletes begin boycotting their respective sports contests in response to the shooting of Jacob Blake.
credit: By Lightburst - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Car_Source_Kenosha_Burned_out_car_lot.jpg
caption: Completely burned out car dealership Car Source Kenosha Burned out car lot 5821 Sheridan Rd, Kenosha, WI 53140

name: Daniel Prude protest
note: Protests breakout in Rochester, New York following the release of police body camera footage of the fatal March 2020 arrest of Daniel Prude.
credit: By Larrymoss~commonswiki - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=94018317
caption: Protesters sit naked in front on Rochester City Hall on September 10, 2020

name: 2020 shooting of Los Angeles police officers
note: Two Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department deputies are shot and critically injured while sitting in their patrol car in Compton, California.

name: Rochester shooting
note: At least 16 people are shot and two confirmed dead in a mass shooting at a backyard party in Rochester, New York.

name: COVID-19 deaths surpass 200,000
note: Nationwide official COVID-19 deaths surpass 200,000.

name: White House COVID-19 outbreak
note: The White House COVID-19 outbreak is realized, as both President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump test positive for COVID-19 and enter quarantine. Several White House staffers and multiple congress members also test positive.
credit: By The White House from Washington, DC - President Trump Nominates Judge Amy Coney Barrett for Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=94570479
caption: President Donald J. Trump announces Judge Amy Coney Barrett as his nominee for Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States Saturday, Sept. 26, 2020, in the Rose Garden of the White House. (Official White House Photo by Andrea Hanks)

name: Gretchen Whitmer kidnapping plot
note: The FBI charges 13 militiamen with plotting to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer at her vacation home. A fourteenth suspect is arrested on October 15.
credit: By Julia Pickett - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=86313798
caption: Gov. Gretchen Whitmer at round table with High School students

name: Killing of Walter Wallace
note: Walter Wallace Jr., 27, is shot and killed by two Philadelphia police officers, resulting in subsequent protests and riots.
credit: By Source (WP:NFCC#4), Fair use, https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?curid=65699547
caption: A screenshot taken from a video of a dispute between two police officers and Walter Wallace, Jr.

name: COVID-19 Daily cases exceeded 100,000
note: The U.S. is the first country to exceed 100,000 daily cases.

name: 2020 United States presidential election
note: The 2020 United States presidential election was the 59th quadrennial presidential election. The Democratic Party ticket of former vice president Joe Biden and incumbent U.S. senator from California Kamala Harris defeated the Republican Party ticket of incumbent president Donald Trump and vice president Mike Pence.
credit: By Magog the Ogre https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:United_States_presidential_election_results_by_county,_2020.svg
caption: Results by county of the 2020 United States presidential election.

name: 2020–21 United States election protests
note: Thousands of protesters march in Washington, D.C. in support of President Trump and his claims of electoral voter fraud.
credit: By Elvert Barnes from Silver Spring MD, USA - IMG_7117a, CC BY-SA 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=96256640
caption: "Count Every Vote" rally in Washington, DC, November 4, 2020

name: Mayfair Mall shooting
note: At least eight people are injured in a mass shooting at the Mayfair Mall in Wauwatosa, Wisconsin.

name: COVID-19 deaths surpass 300,000
note: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide COVID-19 deaths exceed 300,000

name: 2020 Nashville bombing
note: A suicide car bomb explosion in downtown Nashville, Tennessee leaves multiple people injured.
credit: By Andrew Jameson - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=10400030
caption: Second Avenue Commercial District, Nashville TN

name: 2021 storming of the United States Capitol
note: Five people die and at least 56 police officers and five civilians are injured after supporters of President Donald Trump storm the United States Capitol, forcing Congress to evacuate. Congress reconvenes and formally certifies Joe Biden as the next President of the United States in the early morning hours of January 7. President Trump formally concedes to an orderly transition of power to Joe Biden. At least 228 people had been charged related to the storming by February 1.
credit: By Tyler Merbler - https://www.flickr.com/photos/37527185@N05/50812356151/, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=98641393
caption: Protesters gathering outside the Capitol President Trump speaking to supporters at the "Save America" rally A gallows erected outside the building Crowd retreating from tear gas Tear gas being deployed Crowd pressing into the Capitol's Eastern entrance

name: Trump Social Media bans
note: Facebook indefinitely bans President Donald Trump from all of its platforms, citing his role in the January 6 Capitol riot. Twitter permanently suspends President Trump's account the next day, January 8.
caption: A tweet from President Trump about the riots that happened at the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday, Jan. 6, 2021.

name: Inauguration of Joe Biden
note: Joe Biden is sworn in as the 46th President of the United States. At the same time, Kamala Harris becomes the first woman, first Asian American and first African American to be the Vice President of the United States. Donald Trump becomes the first outgoing president to boycott his successor's inauguration since Andrew Johnson in 1869.
credit: By Sgt. Jacob Holmes - https://www.dvidshub.net/image/6488605/59th-presidential-inauguration, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=99059383
caption: Members of the Joint Forces Color Guard march down Pennsylvania Avenue during the 59th Presidential Inauguration in Washington, D.C., Jan. 20, 2021. Military members from across all branches of the armed forces of the United States, including Reserve and National Guard components, provided ceremonial support during the inaugural period. (DoD photo by U.S. Army Sgt. Jacob Holmes)
